app.name: Industrial Ethernet
app.description:
U-Phy Device Application
This application shows how to implement Industrial Ethernet connectivity using the U-Phy middleware. Currently Profinet Device, Ethernet/IP and Modbus TCP Adapter are supported.

The example implements a basic I/O device connecting inputs and outputs to to the EVK buttons and LEDs. Profinet GSDML and EtherNet/IP EDS files are found in the project folder.

After building and programming the example, the EVK can be connected to a Profinet or Ethernet/IP network for evaluation.

RT-Labs U-Phy middleware enables Industrial Ethernet connectivity for Infineon microcontrollers. Key features:
  • Profinet, EtherNet/IP, Modbus support
  • Define process data and device characteristics using U-Phy Device Builder
  • Build time generation of GSDML, EDS and device specific code
  • U-Phy Middleware - U-Phy MTB Middleware on Github
  • U-Phy - General introduction to U-Phy concept and features

app.name: EtherCAT master stack
app.description:
SOEM Master Example Application
This application demonstrates how to implement Industrial Ethernet connectivity using the SOEM middleware.

It includes reference examples for generic use as well as a dedicated example for operating towards an Infineon XMC4800 slave board running a demo image (supplied).

RT-Labs SOEM Middleware enables Industrial Ethernet connectivity for Infineon microcontrollers using EtherCAT. Key features include:
  • EtherCAT master for cyclic I/O and motion devices
  • Lightweight, portable C code
  • Bus scan, topology validation, and SII (slave EEPROM) access
  • CoE support (SDO/OD access) and PDO mapping
  • Distributed Clocks (DC) synchronization for precise cycle timing
  • Simple API for state transitions and process data exchange
  • Reference examples and diagnostics utilities
